roleset.name: destroy
roleset.note: DESTROY-V NOTES: Member of VNcls destroy-44. (from destroy.01-v)
DESTRUCTION-N NOTES: Corresponds with destroy.01 (from destruction.01-n)
DESTRUCTIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from destructive.01-j)

roles.note:
Verbnet predicts an instrumental subject. They also bring thedistinction between agent and instrument down to intentionality, whichwe've been trying to avoid. If you feel you can consistently makethat decision, go ahead; otherwise only use arg2 when there is also anarg0.
ADJ note: not sure an instrument distinct from a destroyer is possible with adj. Where there is just a "causer" default to arg0. (from destroy.01-v)

example.name: no instrument
example.text: Program traders argue that a reinstatement of the rule would destroy the ``pricing efficiency'' of the futures and stock markets.
example.arg: the ``pricing efficiency'' of the futures and stock markets

example.name: with instrument
example.text: Mary destroyed John's fragile self-esteem with a single dirty look.

example.name: Adj example: destructive
example.text: ...no matter how destructive ICH-2 they are [to the coming generations , or to the rest of the biosphere]-2.
example.arg: ICH-2 (to the coming generations , or to the rest of the biosphere)

example.name: Arg0 and Arg1
example.text: The alien warlords' destruction of Delaware was part of their master plan.
